column17: Missile Design and Performance
column18: Platform Integration
column19: Cueing and Detection

column17: AIM-120D-3 features active radar homing, two-way datalink, GPS-aided navigation, and Mach 4 speed for 180 km range with high Pk at NEZ; AIM-260 doubles range to ~200+ km via advanced propulsion and stealthy design for "kick-the-door-down" strikes.
column18: Seamlessly integrates with F-22/F-35 internal bays and F-15EX pylons, enabling 6-8 loads per jet with full fire-and-forget autonomy.
column19: E-3G/E-7A AEWCS provide 400-450 km radar horizons; GAN-LR ground radars and sat-links enable networked targeting via Link-16 for pre-launch updates, extending effective engagement to 250 km. Advanced multi-domain integration via Link-16 and GPS-denied sat-cueing boosts A/D.

column17: R-77M uses active radar with 200 km range, Mach 4 speed, and improved ECCM for high Pk; R-37M hypersonic (Mach 5+) variant with jettisonable booster achieves 300-400 km range for intercepting high-value targets like AWACS.
column18: Heavy Su-35S/Su-57 carry 4-6 R-37Ms externally, with Su-30SM2 adding multi-role flexibility via datalink updates for mid-course guidance.
column19: A-100 AWACS (400 km) and Podsolnukh-E OTH radars (600 km) feed targeting data, enabling lofted launches and 350 km effective envelope against non-maneuvering targets. OTH radar extensions and hypersonic missile kinematics boost C/D.

column17: PL-15 dual-pulse rocket motor, AESA seeker, Mach 5 speed for 200-300 km range with high NEZ Pk; PL-21 ramjet variant extends to 300+ km for anti-AWACS roles.
column18: J-20's internal bays carry 4-6 PL-15s stealthily; J-35A adds conformal loads for sustained BVR without drag penalty.
column19: KJ-3000 AEW (450 km) and P-band GAN radars (500 km) provide mid-course updates via indigenous datalinks, achieving 280 km effective range. Indigenous datalinks and P-band OTH radars enhance A/C/D integration.

column17: AIM-120D-3 active radar, two-way datalink, 180 km range, Mach 4 speed; Rampage ALBM adds 250 km stand-off for suppression.
column18: F-35I internal bays for 4 AIM-120s; F-15IA wing pylons for mixed loads with seamless ELINT fusion.
column19: G-550 CAEW (400 km) and Green Pine (800 km) radars enable networked cueing, extending to 200 km via sat-links. Multi-domain cueing (e.g., Green Pine's extended radar horizon enhancing A and D scores).

column17: Meteor ramjet, Mach 4+, 150-200 km range with large NEZ; AIM-120D-3 complements with 180 km active radar.
column18: Typhoon carries 4-6 Meteors externally; F-35B internal for stealthy loads.
column19: E-7D AEW (400 km) and Type-45 radars (400 km) via Link-16 for 200 km envelope. NATO-standard datalinks enhance D interoperability.

column17: AIM-120D-3 180 km, datalink/GPS; AIM-120C-7 120 km active radar.
column18: F-35A internal bays; F/A-18F external for 6+ loads.
column19: E-7A (400 km) and JORN OTH (3,000 km) extend to 160 km via Link-16. JORN OTH over-the-horizon coverage extends A/D in Pacific theater.

column17: AIM-120D-3 180 km active radar, Mach 4; AAM-4B AESA seeker, 120 km with HOBS.
column18: F-35A internal 4 AIM-120s; F-15J pylons for mixed loads.
column19: E-767 AEW (400 km) and FPS-5 GAN (500 km) via US-allied networks for 160 km effective. US-allied Link-16 compatibility aids D/E.

column17: AIM-120D-3 180 km, high Pk; AIM-120C-7 120 km active radar.
column18: F-35A internal; KF-21 external with indigenous datalinks.
column19: E-737 (400 km) and GAN-LR (500 km) for 160 km networked engagements. KF-21 indigenous elements improve local D/E sustainment.

column17: Meteor ramjet, Mach 4+, 150 km range with large NEZ and high Pk for sustained BVR.
column18: Gripen E/C/D internal/external bays for 4-6 Meteors per jet, MS20 Block 3/4 upgrades enabling seamless mixed loads and AI-assisted targeting.
column19: Erieye AEW (450 km) and Giraffe radars (400 km) provide networked cueing via indigenous datalinks, enabling ~150 km effective envelope with high interoperability.

column17: AIM-120D-3 180 km datalink; Meteor ramjet 150+ km NEZ.
column18: F-35 internal AIM-120; Typhoon 4-6 Meteors external.
column19: E-550 CAEW (400 km) via MBDA networks for 170 km. European MBDA integration supports C/D.

column17: Meteor ramjet 150 km, Mach 4; MICA-NG AESA/IR 100 km dual-mode.
column18: Rafale carries 4-6 Meteors/MICA in mixed loads.
column19: E-3F (400 km) and GroundMaster (450 km) for 150 km via SPECTRA EW. SPECTRA EW suite bolsters E; Meteor Pk aids C.

column17: AIM-120C-7 active radar homing, datalink for mid-course, GPS/INS navigation, Mach 4 speed, ~120 km range with solid Pk at NEZ against non-maneuvering targets.
column18: CF-18A/B upgraded with APG-73 radars and pylons for 6-8 AIM-120C-7 loads, full compatibility with NATO standards.
column19: Relies on shared NORAD E-3 Sentry (400 km) and Arctic OTH radars (up to 3,000 km) for extended cueing via Link-16, enabling ~120 km effective BVR envelope.

column17: Meteor 150 km ramjet; AIM-120C-5 105 km active radar.
column18: Eurofighter 4 Meteors external; Tornado SEAD support.
column19: E-3A (400 km) for 150 km engagements. Tornado SEAD role enhances E in mixed ops.

column17: AIM-120C-7 120 km active radar, Mach 4.
column18: F-16 Block 70 pylons for 6 loads; F-4E legacy support.
column19: E-7T (400 km) for 110 km engagements. Indigenous TF-X development prospects boost future F.

column17: PL-15E AESA, 145-200 km dual-pulse; AIM-120C-5 105 km active.
column18: J-10C/JF-17 internal/external loads; F-16 pylons.
column19: ZDK-03 (350 km) and H-8 GAN (450 km) via Sino-Pak links for 150 km. Sino-Pak datalink fusion aids D despite hybrid fleet.

column17: AIM-120C active radar homing, datalink mid-course, Mach 4, ~105 km range with good Pk at NEZ; Meteor ramjet, Mach 4+, 150 km large NEZ for extended engagements.
column18: F-16 MLU pylons for 6 AIM-120C loads; Gripen C/D internal/external for 4-6 Meteors with MS20 upgrades for mixed compatibility.
column19: Saab 340 Erieye AEW (450 km radar horizon) provides networked cueing via partial Link-16/Saab datalinks, enabling ~130 km effective BVR in SE Asian theater.

column17: AIM-120C-7 120 km datalink; Meteor 150 km ramjet.
column18: EF-18M external; Eurofighter mixed loads.
column19: E-3A (400 km) and GroundMaster (450 km) for 140 km. GroundMaster gap-fillers support A/D.

column17: Fakour-90 semi-active radar homing derived from AIM-54 Phoenix, Mach 5 speed, ~190 km range with moderate Pk at NEZ optimized for AWACS/high-value intercepts.
column18: F-14AM upgraded with indigenous avionics carries up to 6 Fakour-90s under fuselage; F-4E supports legacy Hawk-derived variants for mixed loads.
column19: Simorgh indigenous AEW (400 km radar horizon) and Ghadir OTH ground radars (up to 1,100 km claimed) provide cueing via limited datalinks, enabling ~190 km effective BVR despite sanctions constraints.

column17: Meteor ramjet 150 km NEZ; RVV-AE-PD 120 km active.
column18: Rafale 4 Meteors; Su-30MKI 8 RVV-AE external.
column19: Netra (250 km) and Falcon (400 km) limited by multi-vendor issues for 140 km. Multi-vendor non-integration (French/US/Russian) penalizes D/E.

column17: AIM-120C-7 120 km active; Meteor 150 km NEZ.
column18: F-15SA 8+ loads; Typhoon external.
column19: E-3A (400 km) for 140 km, limited by vendor mix. Vendor mix limits D cohesion.
